CROSS CHECK YOUR HALL TICKET TO CONFIRM THE SUBJECTS TO BE WRITTEN. (IF IT IS NOT THE CORRECT SUBJECT, PLS CHECK THE SECTION AT THE TOP FOR THE SUBJECTS REGISTERED BY YOU)

questions.question_text_1: Read the case study, then answer the given subquestions that follow in about 100-150 words each. Ensure your answers are supported with relevant content from the course and/or suitable examples.  Case: Southwestern Project: Communication Turmoil  Jack asked, “How is the Southwestern project coming along?” Ms. Lee said, “I need to talk to you about that.” “I don’t want to hear any excuses, just get this project done,” Jack yelled to Wei Lee. Ms. Lee said, “Fine. I quit. Do it yourself.” Ms. Lee is the senior project manager and is in charge of completing a customized training program for the firm’s largest client. Jack was hired from the outside just two months ago as vice president of training. Ms. Lee believes that her credentials are more appropriate and impressive than are Jack’s. Ms. Lee expected the job. She has no alternatives lined up. Jack has already earned a reputation for being harsh in a place where people formerly enjoyed working. The particular project in question includes extensive material/course manual preparation as well as classroom sessions. Before the interruption, Ms. Lee was attempting to communicate to Jack that the client had requested a significant variation from what was originally contracted. The good news that Ms. Lee had to share was that the client had agreed to double the fee.

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following methods allows for comparing cash flows across time, either as what a future cash flow is worth today or what an investment made today will be worth in the future?

questions.question_text_1: Regarding recurring deposits, consider the following statements:  1. A fixed sum is deposited every month. 2. The period of deposit is a fixed tenure. 3. Interest is paid at a fixed deposit rate.  Which of the above statement(s) is/are correct?

questions.question_text_1: For the conflict situations, identify the most appropriate conflict management style from the options given:  You have joined a committee to meet people and build professional relationships. Your interest in what the committee does is low. While serving on the committee, you make a recommendation that is opposed by another member. You realize that the conflict is trivial and step back to preserve harmony without confrontation. The other party is using a forcing style.
question_texts: For the conflict situations, identify the most appropriate conflict management style from the options given:  You have joined a committee to meet people and build professional relationships. Your interest in what the committee does is low. While serving on the committee, you make a recommendation that is opposed by another member. You realize that the conflict is trivial and step back to preserve harmony without confrontation. The other party is using a forcing style.

questions.question_text_1: For the conflict situations, identify the most appropriate conflict management style from the options given:  You are on a task force that has to select new pieces of equipment for the office. It’s the brand, price, and service that people disagree on and hence requires optimal solution.
question_texts: For the conflict situations, identify the most appropriate conflict management style from the options given:  You are on a task force that has to select new pieces of equipment for the office. It’s the brand, price, and service that people disagree on and hence requires optimal solution.

questions.question_text_1: For the conflict situations, identify the most appropriate conflict management style from the options given:  You are a senior sales manager. Bhanu, one of your new salespeople, is trying to close a big sale. The two of you are discussing the next sales call she will make. You disagree with the strategy proposed by Bhanu to be used to close the sale. Due to your seniority, you decide to assert your perspective and direct the strategy for the upcoming sales call.
question_texts: For the conflict situations, identify the most appropriate conflict management style from the options given:  You are a senior sales manager. Bhanu, one of your new salespeople, is trying to close a big sale. The two of you are discussing the next sales call she will make. You disagree with the strategy proposed by Bhanu to be used to close the sale. Due to your seniority, you decide to assert your perspective and direct the strategy for the upcoming sales call.

questions.question_text_1: For the conflict situations, identify the most appropriate conflict management style from the options given:  You’re already late and on your way to an important meeting. As you leave your office, at the other end of the work area you see Chaitanya, one of your employees, seems to be goofing off instead of working.

questions.question_text_1: For the conflict situations, identify the most appropriate conflict management style from the options given:  You’re over budget for labour this month. It’s slow, so you ask Kashiful, a part-time employee, to leave work early. Kashiful tells you he doesn’t want to go because he needs the money. But Kashiful has been an exceptional employee thus far and you are willing to maintain a positive working relationship and retain a valuable employee.

questions.question_text_1: A team of five individuals was assigned a complex project that required diverse skills and expertise. Each team member had their own strengths and knowledge in specific areas. However, when they collaborated and combined their efforts, they were able to achieve remarkable results that exceeded their initial expectations.  Based on the given caselet, Which concept best represents the collaborative effect produced by the team, resulting in outcomes that surpassed the individual contributions?
question_texts: A team of five individuals was assigned a complex project that required diverse skills and expertise. Each team member had their own strengths and knowledge in specific areas. However, when they collaborated and combined their efforts, they were able to achieve remarkable results that exceeded their initial expectations.  Based on the given caselet, Which concept best represents the collaborative effect produced by the team, resulting in outcomes that surpassed the individual contributions?

questions.question_text_1: XYZ Corporation has recently implemented self-managed teams to improve operational efficiency and promote employee empowerment. The organization is keen on ensuring the effectiveness of these teams in achieving its goals.  Based on the given caselet, which of the following steps should managers AVOID taking to ensure the effectiveness of self-managed teams?
question_texts: XYZ Corporation has recently implemented self-managed teams to improve operational efficiency and promote employee empowerment. The organization is keen on ensuring the effectiveness of these teams in achieving its goals.  Based on the given caselet, which of the following steps should managers AVOID taking to ensure the effectiveness of self-managed teams?

options.option_text: Empower teams with sufficient responsibility and autonomy.
Assign adequately complex tasks to the teams.
Evaluate and address the training needs of team members.
Direct supervision and control over the teams.

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following factors is crucial for successful change management and effective teamwork?
question_texts: Which of the following factors is crucial for successful change management and effective teamwork?

options.option_text: Open communication and transparent information sharing
Strict hierarchical structure and top-down decision-making
Resistance to change and maintaining the status quo

questions.question_text_1: Which type of group is exemplified by a group of workers coming together to interact socially, both during work hours and outside of work?
question_texts: Which type of group is exemplified by a group of workers coming together to interact socially, both during work hours and outside of work?

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following strategies can help in connecting with your audience during a presentation?  1. Repeating a summary slide from your previous presentation. 2. Separating facts from opinions. 3. Pausing to enable a decision. 4. Explaining what is being shown. 5. Using familiar formats.  Select the correct options:

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following is NOT included in emotional intelligence?
question_texts: Which of the following is NOT included in emotional intelligence?

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following options best describes emotions?
question_texts: Which of the following options best describes emotions?

options.option_text: Objective responses to experiences in our environment.
Subjective responses to experiences in our environment.
Physiological changes to experiences in our environment.
Behavioural changes to experiences in our environment.

questions.question_text_1: Ahmedi notices that her team member, Risan, seems to be feeling down and is not as engaged in his work as usual. She approaches him and asks if everything is alright. Risan opens up about some personal problems he's been facing. Ahmedi listens attentively, offers support, and suggests seeking professional help if needed.  Based on the given caselet, Which dimension of Emotional Intelligence is Ahmedi demonstrating in this scenario?
question_texts: Ahmedi notices that her team member, Risan, seems to be feeling down and is not as engaged in his work as usual. She approaches him and asks if everything is alright. Risan opens up about some personal problems he's been facing. Ahmedi listens attentively, offers support, and suggests seeking professional help if needed.  Based on the given caselet, Which dimension of Emotional Intelligence is Ahmedi demonstrating in this scenario?

questions.question_text_1: Rajkishore is known for his optimistic outlook and positive feelings towards his colleagues, work, and organizational goals. He often expresses enthusiasm, shows appreciation for others' contributions, and maintains a positive mindset even in challenging situations.  Based on the given caselet,Which psychological construct refers to Rajkishore's positive or negative feelings about people, things, and issues?

He often expresses enthusiasm, shows appreciation for others' contributions, and maintains a positive mindset even in challenging situations. questions.question_text_1: State whether the following statement is true or false:  “Self-awareness relates to being conscious of your emotions and how they affect your personal and professional life.”
question_texts: State whether the following statement is true or false:  “Self-awareness relates to being conscious of your emotions and how they affect your personal and professional life.”

props.summary:
### Summary of Core Topics, Concepts, Principles, and Equations

#### Core Topics and Concepts

1. **Effective Communication and Listening**
   - Rules for effective listening
   - Communication practices
   - Conflict management styles (avoiding, accommodating, forcing, negotiating, collaborating)

2. **Financial Management**
   - Time value of money
   - Fixed and variable expenses
   - Recurring deposits
   - Long-term investments and savings accounts
   - Risky investments (e.g., cryptocurrency)

3. **Leadership Styles**
   - Job-centered leadership
   - Employee-centered leadership

4. **Team Dynamics and Management**
   - Synergy
   - Self-managed teams
   - Effective teamwork and change management
   - Types of groups (formal, informal, cross-functional, virtual teams)

5. **Emotional Intelligence**
   - Self-awareness
   - Social awareness
   - Self-management
   - Empathy
   - Attitudes and psychological constructs

6. **Presentation Skills**
   - Strategies for connecting with the audience
   - Separating facts from opinions
   - Using familiar formats

#### Important Principles and Equations

1. **Time Value of Money**
   - **Future Value (FV)**: \( FV = PV \times (1 + r)^n \)
   - **Present Value (PV)**: \( PV = \frac{FV}{(1 + r)^n} \)
   - Where \( PV \) is the present value, \( FV \) is the future value, \( r \) is the interest rate, and \( n \) is the number of periods.

2. **Simple Interest**
   - **Simple Interest (SI)**: \( SI = P \times r \times t \)
   - Where \( P \) is the principal amount, \( r \) is the interest rate, and \( t \) is the time.

3. **Compounding**
   - **Compound Interest (CI)**: \( A = P \times (1 + \frac{r}{n})^{n \times t} \)
   - Where \( A \) is the amount of money accumulated after n years, including interest.

### Knowledge Graph 

```mermaid
graph TD;
    A[Effective Communication] --> B[Listening Rules]
    A --> C[Communication Practices]
    A --> D[Conflict Management Styles]
    D --> E[Avoiding]
    D --> F[Accommodating]
    D --> G[Forcing]
    D --> H[Negotiating]
    D --> I[Collaborating]
    J[Financial Management] --> K[Time Value of Money]
    J --> L[Fixed and Variable Expenses]
    J --> M[Recurring Deposits]
    J --> N[Long-term Investments]
    J --> O[Risky Investments]
    P[Leadership Styles] --> Q[Job-centered Leadership]
    P --> R[Employee-centered Leadership]
    S[Team Dynamics] --> T[Synergy]
    S --> U[Self-managed Teams]
    S --> V[Effective Teamwork]
    S --> W[Types of Groups]
    X[Emotional Intelligence] --> Y[Self-awareness]
    X --> Z[Social Awareness]
    X --> AA[Self-management]
    X --> AB[Empathy]
    X --> AC[Attitudes]
    AD[Presentation Skills] --> AE[Connecting with Audience]
    AD --> AF[Separating Facts from Opinions]
    AD --> AG[Using Familiar Formats]
```

This summary and knowledge graph should help you focus on the essential topics and understand the relationships between them for your exam preparation.
